At scale, we project that the cost of community-based ART could be similar to previously published estimates of the cost of clinic ART. 17, 18 However, questions remain regarding how community-based ART could be implemented at scale in the absence of established delivery platforms and systems. Refining components of the community-based ART delivery strategy could decrease or contain costs, which might be necessary in areas where the density of clients is low. For example, providing 6-month resupply of ART instead of 3-month resupply could save personnel costs with no difference in viral suppression or retention in care.
32 Alternative methods to increase viral suppression while containing costs also warrant comparison. 33, 34
